remarks:
Define the epsilon relation.  Similar to Definition 6.22 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30.  The epsilon relation and set membership are the same, that is, ` ( A _E B <-> A e. B ) ` when ` B ` is a set by ~ epelg .  Thus, ` 5 _E { 1 , 5 } ` ( ~ ex-eprel ).  (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-1995.) 

---

 Define the epsilon relation.  Similar to Definition 6.22 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30.  The epsilon relation and set membership are the same, that is, ` ( A _E B <-> A e. B ) ` when ` B ` is a set by ~ epelg .  Thus, 5 ` _E ` { 1 , 5 }.  (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-1995.)
statement:
df-eprel $p |- _E = { <. x , y >. | x e. y } $.
$d x y $.
